intro: Coptosperma supra-axillare, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
